# Lyra Web3 Playground
> Interactive browser-based IDE for learning blockchain development

## Overview
Lyra Web3 Playground is a free, open-source platform for learning Solidity and blockchain development. Users can write, compile, and deploy smart contracts directly in their browser without any setup.

## Key Features
- Browser-based Solidity IDE with syntax highlighting
- Real-time compilation using solc.js
- Deploy to Ethereum testnets (Sepolia, Goerli) and mainnets
- 40+ smart contract templates (ERC-20, ERC-721, ERC-1155, DeFi, NFT)
- 50+ interactive tutorials from beginner to advanced
- Multi-chain support: Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, Base, Avalanche, BSC
- AI-powered code generation and explanation
- Community sharing and project discovery

## Target Audience
- Developers learning blockchain development
- Students studying smart contract programming
- Experienced developers prototyping contracts quickly
- Educators teaching Web3 concepts

## Technical Stack
- Frontend: React 18, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Vite
- Editor: Monaco Editor (VS Code's editor)
- Compiler: solc.js (Solidity compiler for JavaScript)
- Wallet: ethers.js, Web3Modal, WalletConnect
- Backend: Node.js, Express (optional API server)

## Accessibility
- WCAG 2.1 Level AA compliant
- Screen reader support with ARIA live regions
- Full keyboard navigation
- Visual feedback for deaf/hard-of-hearing users
- High contrast and reduced motion support

## API Endpoints
The optional backend API provides:
- POST /api/compile - Compile Solidity code
- POST /api/ai/generate - AI code generation
- POST /api/ai/explain - AI code explanation
- GET /api/templates - List contract templates
- POST /api/share - Share projects

## Example Usage
1. Visit https://lyra.works/sandbox
2. Select "Solidity" mode
3. Write or paste your smart contract
4. Click "Compile" to check for errors
5. Connect your wallet (MetaMask, etc.)
6. Click "Deploy" to deploy to testnet
7. Interact with your contract via the generated UI
